alert.note: Alert for Jasper (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 7:25AM EST until February 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Indiana... Iroquois River at Rensselaer affecting Jasper County. For the Iroquois River...including Rensselaer...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Iroquois River at Rensselaer. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Flooding of agricultural lands begin. Flooding begins to backyards and cemetery along the river. Flooding of Lairds Landing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 11.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall to 8.9 feet and begin rising again Monday morning. It will rise to 9.7 feet Tuesday evening. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation and snowmelt as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected around 1230 AM CST late tonight.
